Title: Lamido and I would’ve challenged Tinubu if we were governors — Amaechi
Summary: Rotimi Amaechi says Sule Lamido and I would’ve challenged Tinubu if we were governors . Former Rivers State Governor and ex-Minister of Transportation said the current state of governance in Nigeria would have met firm resistance .

Title: I started paying tithe from secondary school – Taiwo Awoniyi
Summary: Taiwo Awoniyi says he formed the habit of paying tithe from secondary school days . The 27-year-old says whenever someone gave him money as little as N5 in those days, he paid tithe .

Title: NUC grants full accreditation to 23 programmes in UNICAL
Summary: The National Universities Commission has granted full accreditation to 23 academic programmes in the University of Calabar (UNICAL) This follows the NUC accreditation exercise conducted in October/November 2024 .

Title: Troops neutralise bandit, recover AK-47 in Taraba
Summary: Troops neutralized a suspected bandit and recovered an AK-47 rifle . The operation took place in Karim Lamido Local Government Area of Taraba State . Troops of the 6 Brigade, Nigerian Army, under Sector 3 of Operation WHIRL STROKE .

Title: Troops strike terrorists in Sokoto, Zamfara forests, kill six
Summary: Nigerian troops have penetrated deep into terrorist strongholds across parts of Sokoto and Zamfara States, dismantling insurgent infrastructure and recovering weapons . The multi-day operation, which began with coordinated assaults on militants, killed six .

Title: Amotekun rescues 5 kidnap victims in Ondo, stops N150m ransom payment
Summary: The Western Nigeria Security Network, Amotekun Corps in Ondo, says five people have been rescued from kidnappers in the state without the payment of N150 million ransom . The victims were rescued on May 6 and May 10 .

Title: Oshiomhole challenges Abati to ‘street fight’ over alleged disrespect
Summary: Senator representing Edo North, Adams Oshiomhole, has challenged Arise TV anchor and former presidential spokesperson, Dr. Reuben Abati, to a street fight over what he described as "disrespectful" and "mischievous" comments made on live television .

Title: Judge backs Trump use of wartime law for deportation
Summary: Trump invoked the little-known AEA, which was last used to round up Japanese-American citizens during World War II . Trump flew two planeloads of alleged Tren de Aragua members to a maximum security prison in El Salvador .

Title: Wigwe: Helicopter crash rooted in company’s poor safety culture – NSIB
Summary: Director General of NSIB, Captain Alex Badeh Jr., said the crash suggested systemic issues within the company’s safety culture, rather than pilot error .

Title: French authorities urge crypto industry action after kidnap attempts target executives’ families
Summary: French interior minister says he will meet with cryptocurrency professionals to discuss how to prevent future kidnappings for ransom . Several high-profile cases in France have targeted executives' families in recent years .

Title: Chimamanda Adichie to headline 2025 Things Fall Apart festival in Enugu
Summary: Award-winning novelist, Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, has been announced as the headliner of the 2025 Things Fall Apart Festival . The festival will take place from June 29 to July 5, 2025, at the Centre for Memories in Enugu . It will be a week-long celebration of Chinua Achebe

Title: Cross River gov unveils diaspora commission
Summary: Governor Bassey Otu inaugurated Cross River State Diaspora Commission . The commission will engage Cross Riverians abroad in state policies and development projects . Otu emphasised the critical role the commission will play across the global diaspora community .
